text: The speed of light is the same in all media.
Newton's Third Law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
In a vacuum, a feather and a hammer will fall at different rates.
Kinetic energy is always a positive quantity.
Ohm's Law relates voltage, current, and resistance in an electrical circuit.
Conduction is the only form of heat transfer.
An object in motion stays in motion unless acted upon by a net external force.
Quantum mechanics can accurately predict the position and velocity of a particle simultaneously.
Light exhibits both particle and wave properties.
The mass of an object increases as it approaches the speed of light.
